results.title: George and Toula
results.creator_credit: Debby Kingsland, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A portrait of a marriage within the Greek community. George is Greek-born and Toula second-generation Australian. Toula has had a tertiary education and works in social services. She experiences much greater ambivalence about the traditions in which she was raised than her husband. The film is designed to show how an ethnic community shapes the lives of its members.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Debby Kingsland, Tom Manefield and Film Australia

results.title: Child development
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Coastline Community College and Southern California Consortium
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Time to grow”.
Introduces the series, defines developmental psychology, provides a brief historical overview, and poses many of the questions discussed in later programs.

results.title: Minh: a Vietnamese
results.creator_credit: Nick Torrens, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A look at the life of a Vietnamese refugee in Australia. Minh talks about his life and hopes for his children in his new country.

results.title: Sue and Mario: the Italian Australians
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
An introduction to the hybrid lifestyles resulting from the marriage of two second-generation Australians of different ethnic origins. Both Sue and Mario are second generation Australians. Sue’s family migrated from England, whilst Mario’s came from Italy. The couple live in Griffith, a N.S.W. rural community where more than fifty per cent of the population is of Italian descent. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phil Noyce, Jan Sharp and Film Australia

results.title: Sadek: speaking English
results.creator_credit: Michael Robertson, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A biographical account of an Egyptian migrant, Sadek. The film discusses the adult education classes he attends, and the problems he has to face with his limited knowledge of English Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Maria going home
results.creator_credit: Debby Kingsland, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Maria, originally from Spain, has been in Australia some fifteen years - half her life. In the film she and her family discuss plans to return to Spain. The film is intended to show why a family, materially and professionally successful in Australia and with two Australian born children might choose to uproot themselves a second time.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Debby Kingsland, Tom Manefield and Film Australia

results.title: Our multicultural society
results.creator_credit: Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A series which focuses on individuals from a variety of minority groups in Australia to illustrate the particular problems that these groups may encounter.

results.title: Tempted
results.creator_credit: Bill Bennett, David Kronemyer, Jennifer Cluff, Larry Katz, Golden Circle Films and TFI International
results.brief_description: Written, produced and directed by Australian filmmaker Bill Bennett (“Kiss or Kill”) this erotic thriller set in Louisiana, New Orleans, explores the boundaries of fidelity and friendship. A wealthy businessman Charlie (Burt Reynolds) pays a young carpenter, Jimmy (Peter Facinelli), who is under his employ to try and seduce his wife, offering to pay him $10,000 for the attempt and a further $40,000 if he can identify a ‘mark’ hidden on her body. Although he swears not to tell anyone about the offer Jimmy confides in his best friend, showing him the photograph of the young and beautiful wife Lilly (Saffron Burrows). Not trusting his wife or Jimmy, Charlie uses the services of a private detective to wire his house and obtain video evidence of any possible sexual encounters. As it is the steamy South, guns, intrigue and murder ensue as Lilly finds out about the deal and goes ahead with the affair. Great original music composed by David Bridie adds to the swampy New Orleans locations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Bennett, David Kronemyer, Jennifer Cluff, Larry Katz, Golden Circle Films and TFI International

results.title: Temples of time
results.creator_credit: William Canning and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A mountain is a living thing; it has an ecological balance, a process of evolution manifested in slow, subtle ways; but it is also subject to the ravages of human intervention. Filmed in the Canadian Rockies and in Garibaldi Park, this picture brings to the screen magnificent footage of mountain solitudes and the wildlife found there, of natural splendor in all its changing moods. The film carries the implicit warning that all this may pass away if people do not seek to preserve it.

results.title: Ethnic broadcasting
results.creator_credit: Linda Blagg, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Shows how a group of Greek women and men started their own radio program motivated by pride and interest in their own ethnic origins and an awareness of the cultural deprivation of Greek migrants in Adelaide.
